data.title: Sony Pictures Home Entertainment
data.meta_description: Sony Pictures Home Entertainment (abbreviated as SPHE) is the home video distribution division of Sony Pictures Entertainment, a subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation. It was established in June 1978 as Columbia Pictures Home Entertainment, and released 20 titles in November 1979. Its first 20...
data.text:
Catalog number Film title Film country Film year Running time Version MPAA rating Film format Number of tapes Break placement (if applicable) Color Release date Notes 10000 The Anderson Tapes USA 1971 99 minutes Standard version PG Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979

For at least a few seconds before the start of the program, a series of tones can faintly be heard.

10030 Born Free UK 1966 91 minutes Standard version PG Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

As late as 1991, copies have been known to come in 1984 RCA/Columbia boxes with RCA/Columbia labels.

10060 Born Yesterday USA 1950 103 minutes Standard version NR Academy 1 N/A Black and white November 1979 TBD 10090 Breakout USA 1975 96 minutes Standard version PG Panavisioon 1 N/A Color November 1979

Reissued with the red border clamshell packaging during the summer of 1980.

10120 Bye Bye Birdie USA 1963 112 minutes Standard version G Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979

The first few seconds of the Columbia Pictures Home Entertainment logo are cut off on this release.

The FBI warning screen also abruptly cuts to black at the end on this release.

As late as 1991, copies have been known to come in 1985 RCA/Columbia boxes with RCA/Columbia labels.

10150 The Deep UK/USA 1977 118 minutes (1979-1980)

123 minutes (1980 onward)

Standard version PG Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979

Early pressings of this release were presented at 25 frames per second.

Reissued with the red border clamshell packaging during the summer of 1980.

10180 Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River UK/USA 1968 99 minutes Standard version G Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979

The copyright year on the cover artwork and sticker label reads "1967", which is the year the film was produced and copyrighted, unlike other titles in this wave which use the year the film was released as its copyright year.

10210 Fun with Dick and Jane USA 1977 91 minutes Standard version PG Matted 1.66 1 N/A Color November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

The opening and closing credit sequences are presented in letterbox format with red bars at the top and bottom of the screen.

10240 Gilda USA 1946 110 minutes Standard version NR Academy 1 N/A Black and white November 1979 TBD 10270 The Harder They Fall USA 1956 104 minutes Standard version NR Matted 1.85 1 N/A Black and white November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

Original Columbia Pictures logo preserved at the end.

As late as 1991, copies have been known to come in 1986 RCA/Columbia boxes with RCA/Columbia labels.

10300 Harry and Walter Go to New York USA 1976 106 minutes Standard version PG Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

10330 Here Comes Mr. Jordan USA 1941 94 minutes Standard version NR Academy 1 N/A Black and white November 1979

If you look closely at the start, you can see the 1936 Columbia Pictures logo fading into the opening credits following the opening Columbia Pictures Home Entertainment logo.

10360 A Man for All Seasons UK 1966 115 minutes Standard version G Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

Reissued with the red border clamshell packaging during the summer of 1980.

Later pressings, beginning in June 1983, were closed-captioned.

10400 Midnight Express UK/USA 1978 116 minutes (1979-1980)

121 minutes (1980 onward)

Standard version R Academy 1 N/A Color November 1979

Early pressings of this release were presented at 25 frames per second.

Reissued with the red border clamshell packaging during the summer of 1980.

The original 1979 release had a 1979 copyright notice on the front cover, and a 1978 copyright notice on the back cover. Also, the film's title was red on the cover, which was more common on the February 1980 lineup's releases, as opposed to the November 1979 wave's blue title color.

Later pressings, beginning in June 1983, were closed-captioned.

10420 Mysterious Island UK/USA 1961 101 minutes Standard version NR Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979

Later pressings, beginning in June 1983, were closed-captioned.

10450 The New Centurions USA 1972 103 minutes Standard version R Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979 TBD 10480 Shamus USA 1973 94 minutes Standard version PG Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979

Presented at 25 frames per second.

10510 Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger UK/USA 1977 113 minutes Standard version G Matted 1.85 1 N/A Color November 1979 TBD 10540 The Taming of the Shrew Italy/USA 1967 121 minutes Standard version NR Panavision 1 N/A Color November 1979

As late as 1991, copies have been known to come in 1986 RCA/Columbia boxes with RCA/Columbia labels.
